title: 10 Ways To Get Moving When You Don't Feel Like It
summary: If youâ€™re not feeling the workout on any given day, try to go with the flow. Reward yourself with a special snack or bubble bath afterward. Find a friend or group to work out with you to help you stay motivated. Use apps and fitness trackers to keep you on track and set new goals for yourself each day. Take a break and shake it off, even if you're feeling discouraged or discouraged, it can be helpful to do deep breathing exercises or take a break from your workout.

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`New Year\u2019s resolutions are the perfect time to start fresh, refocus our efforts, and commit to a healthier lifestyle. Many of us make the common resolution to exercise more. However, that can be easier said than done for some people. If you don\u2019t feel like working out one day, it doesn\u2019t mean you stop going to the gym or just give up entirely. It means you have to come up with creative ways to stay motivated and get moving when you don\u2019t feel like it.
Exercising is not always fun, but we need it to remain healthy and fit. While some people love sweating in their favorite gym class, others avoid workouts because they know how much they hate them. While exercise can be difficult at times, there are lots of different ways you can make moving more fun so that it becomes second nature and something you no longer dread.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

content.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:o,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:o,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("h2",null,"Go With The Flow"),mdx("p",null,`If you\u2019re not feeling the workout on any given day, try to go with the flow. Don\u2019t force yourself to do something that you\u2019re not enjoying or that you\u2019re not good at just because you feel like you should. If you\u2019re trying and failing to do complicated moves that you\u2019re not good at, you\u2019ll likely end up getting frustrated and end up stopping your workout altogether.
You don\u2019t need to push yourself too hard on a given day. If you\u2019re not feeling the workout, try a few of these tips to get yourself going again.`),mdx("h2",null,"Reward Yourself"),mdx("p",null,`When you do something you don\u2019t like, such as going to the gym, it can be helpful to give yourself a reward afterward. This can be anything from a special snack, to a bubble bath, or even just a few minutes of alone time. Whatever you reward yourself with, you should only do it after completing the task, so that it is associated with that.
If you\u2019re someone who is trying to lose weight, you might not want to reward yourself with a treat like ice cream or a donut. Try to go for something a bit healthier, like a smoothie or a piece of fruit.`),mdx("h2",null,"Find A Friend Or Join A Group"),mdx("p",null,`If you\u2019re not enjoying your workout, try finding a friend to work out with you. Working out with a friend can be a great way to help you get motivated, stay focused, and push yourself further than you would on your own.
Find someone who is at a similar fitness level to work out with you. You don\u2019t want to work out with someone who is way more fit than you, because you might not be able to keep up, and you won\u2019t get anything out of it. However, you also don\u2019t want to work out with someone who isn\u2019t at a similar fitness level as you. This can be discouraging, and you might end up holding each other back.`),mdx("h2",null,"Utilize Apps And Trackers"),mdx("p",null,"If you don\u2019t enjoy going to the gym and prefer to workout at home, try using an app or a fitness tracker to keep you on track. Apps such as My Fitness Pal, Fitbit, and Apple Health can help you track your progress and set new goals for yourself each day. Fitness trackers such as Fitbit are great for keeping track of your progress, as well as setting new goals and keeping you on track. Working out can be monotonous, so having something to keep you entertained and focused on can help you stay on task."),mdx("p",null,"If you are not working out at home, but prefer to go to the gym, try getting to the gym earlier in the day. This will help you avoid crowds and long lines, as well as having the gym all to yourself to work out."),mdx("h2",null,"Hit The Shower"),mdx("p",null,"If you aren\u2019t feeling motivated to workout at all, try getting into the shower earlier in the day. Exercising in the shower can be a great way to get your blood flowing, warm up your muscles, and get your heart rate up without even realizing it. If you do want to try exercising in the shower, make sure you don\u2019t get the water too hot, and make sure you dry off before heading back into your room."),mdx("p",null,"You can try doing some basic exercises, including lunges and squats, as well as shoulder presses, chest presses, and crunches. You can even try doing some yoga poses in the shower."),mdx("h2",null,"Take A Break And Shake It Off"),mdx("p",null,`Sometimes, you just have to shake things off, even if you\u2019re feeling super discouraged. It\u2019s not uncommon to get frustrated during a workout. If something doesn\u2019t go as planned, or you don\u2019t feel like you\u2019re making progress, it\u2019s okay to feel a bit defeated.
When you feel defeated, it can be helpful to take a short break from your workout and shake it off. Walk around the gym, or take a quick break outside. Doing some deep breathing exercises or positive affirmations can be helpful. You can try saying things such as, \u201CI am strong,\u201D or \u201CI can do this,\u201D to help you get back on track when you feel discouraged.`),mdx("h2",null,"Don\u2019t Be Hard On Yourself"),mdx("p",null,`Exercising should be something you enjoy, not something that you dread, so try to not be so hard on yourself. If you\u2019re not enjoying a certain class, or you\u2019re just not finding the right workout for you, don\u2019t feel bad about changing things up.
If you\u2019re not enjoying the workout you\u2019re doing, it can be helpful to challenge yourself by pushing yourself a little harder. If you\u2019re not pushing yourself hard enough, it can be easy to get bored and lose interest in your workout. Throwing in some harder moves or increasing the intensity of your workout can help prevent this.`),mdx("p",null,"If you\u2019re not enjoying a certain class, try a new one, or even a new instructor. Not only can this help you stay motivated, but it can also help you mix things up and prevent boredom from setting in."),mdx("h2",null,"Bottom line"),mdx("p",null,"When you don\u2019t feel like going to the gym or working out, it can be easy to make an excuse as to why you can\u2019t. However, there are lots of ways to get yourself motivated and moving when you don\u2019t feel like it, even just for 10 minutes. If you don\u2019t enjoy going to the gym, find an alternative workout like yoga or hiking. There are lots of ways to get moving when you don\u2019t feel like it, you just have to find what works best for you."),mdx("p",null,"The most important thing to remember is that when you don\u2019t feel like moving, you have to make yourself do it. You\u2019re only hurting yourself by not making time for a workout, so no matter how you feel, you have to make it happen."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Make Healthy Eating Easier with Meal Planning

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Thinking about meal planning sounds like more trouble than it\u2019s worth. And for many people, it feels that way. We all lead such busy lives and between work, school, family obligations, and social activities, it can feel like there\u2019s not enough hours in the day to squeeze in planning and prepping meals.
We can all agree that eating well is essential to living a healthy life. But sticking to healthy eating habits can be challenging and require some serious willpower. Even if you\u2019re committed to good nutrition, finding the time and energy to shop for fresh ingredients, prep them for the week, and reheat them throughout the week is exhausting just thinking about it! Fortunately, there are several sneaky strategies you can use to make healthy eating easier.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 10 Easy Ways to Cut Sugar from Your Diet

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`In recent years, sugar has received a lot of negative attention. From the link between sugar and obesity to the prevalence of diabetes, research on sugar and its potential health effects continues to grow.
There are many different types of sugars out there, but common table sugar or sucrose is the one you need to cut back on. Eating too much sugar can lead to weight gain, high blood pressure and other health problems. If you\u2019ve read any articles about how bad sugar is for you, then you probably already know this. However, cutting back on sugar isn\u2019t always easy. Sugar is in almost everything! Luckily, we\u2019ve compiled a list of 10 super helpful tips that will teach you how to cut back on your intake of this not-so-nice white substance\u2026`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Get Moving When You Don't Have Time for the Gym

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`New Year, same old resolutions. If you\u2019re anything like the majority of people, chances are that you have made the same resolution to get fitter, healthier and happier this year as you did last year. But with a packed work schedule, social calendar and everything else going on in your life it can be difficult to find time to hit the gym or take up that new Zumba class you signed up for last October but never went to again.
And yet so many of us do manage to get moving. Yes, it might involve setting your alarm an hour earlier than usual, waking up on Saturday morning instead of Friday night and putting in some serious dedication \u2014 but it is possible. So if you\u2019re struggling to find time for the gym here are some creative ways how you can get moving when you don\u2019t have time for the gym:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Benefits of a Plant-Based Diet
How to Cope with Stress Eating
The Best Healthy Dinner Recipes for a Busy Week

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Are you in a constant state of busy? Between work, school, and social events, it can feel like there\u2019s no time left in the day. But that doesn\u2019t mean you have to forgo healthy home-cooked meals. In fact, research shows eating at home more often is one of the small changes that lead to big weight loss over time. Healthy dinners don\u2019t have to take long to make or cost a lot of money. With these healthy dinner recipes for a busy week, you can have wholesome meals with minimal effort and expense.
Add variety to your diet with these ideas for main dishes, snacks, sides, sauces, and drinks all based on common ingredients found in most kitchens. Preparing your own food instead of eating out or buying pre-made meals saves money while also helping you eat better. You may not think it now but these concepts are simple and will be very helpful when you are preparing your own food instead of eating outside or pre-made meal packs consistently after reading this article .`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"You\u2019ve probably heard it before: When you\u2019re busy, you need healthy snacks to keep you going. The problem is that it\u2019s not always easy to find healthy snacks that are also fast and convenient. In our hectic, on-the-go world, most of us don\u2019t have time to sit down for a healthy meal three times a day. Instead, we\u2019re often forced to make snap decisions about what we can eat quickly and conveniently. Unfortunately, those decisions too often lead to less than healthy snack options like potato chips or sweets. However, there are plenty of great ways to get your recommended daily intake of fruits and veggies even when you\u2019re on the go. These 30 healthy snacks for on-the-go are perfect for keeping in your purse, desk drawer, locker, or anywhere else you might find yourself hungry and without access to a full meal."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Get Started with a Plant-Based Diet

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`If you\u2019ve been reading the news or browsing Instagram recently, you may have noticed a growing trend of plant-based diets. Famous celebrities, athletes and even foodies are swearing off meat and animal products to lead a more plant-based life.
This practice is also known as \u201Cveganism\u201D or an \u201Cethical vegan\u201D diet. In addition to eating plants for most of your calories, a plant-based diet eliminates or reduces your consumption of animal products like meat, eggs, dairy and honey.
The reasons for going plant-based are as varied as the people who do it. Some people feel that this diet is the best way to reduce their carbon footprint and live in harmony with nature. Others see it as a healthier alternative to the Standard American Diet (SAD).
Many simply like the taste of plants more than meat. Whatever your reason for trying a plant- A great first step is learning how to start with these tips!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`When you\u2019re anxious, you feel your heart pounding, and your palms get sweaty. We\u2019ve all experienced some level of anxiety from time to time \u2014 it can be perfectly normal. However, for some people, anxiety can become debilitating and start to have a negative impact on their everyday life. If you experience social anxiety or general anxiety more often than not, read on to discover how to deal with it effectively.
If you struggle with anxiety frequently and strongly, you are certainly not alone. In fact, almost 20% of adults in the United States experience some form of anxiety or another on a regular basis. Although there is no magical cure for dealing with anxiety permanently, there are many things that you can do to manage your symptoms better and live a happier life as a result.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 10 Ways to Make Your Commute Less Stressful

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`When you think about your daily commute, it probably doesn\u2019t strike you as being particularly stressful. In fact, many people see their daily drive to work or school as a time for peace and quiet. After all, what could possibly be stressful about getting from point A to point B?
It\u2019s true that your commute isn\u2019t inherently stressful. In theory, it\u2019s just a short period of time each day when you go from home to work (or vise versa). But even the most seemingly insignificant details can make a big difference. Read on to learn more about how you can reduce stress during your commute and get to work happier every day!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
